data.title: Geat Food and Great Location
data.text: Visiting Albany and were told we must go to Wellington's. So glad we did! First of all, the location is amazing. Right in the heart of the city across the street from the Capitol Building. Fabulous view at night. The decor is chic and fun, yet very relaxed. Lots of couches and comfy seating areas, not your standard dining room. The service is really friendly and everyone was super attentive. Best of all was the food. Quite a varied menu with lots of yummy appetizers We tried many, but especially liked the brussells sprouts, the burrata and the hushpuppies. And all of our main dishes were excellent. The lamb was perfectly cooked and tender and tasty as could be. The gnocchi with lobster was outstanding. But the star of the night was the crazy pot du creme dessert. It came in a covered mason jar and when you opened the lid smoke erupted out, making it quite exciting, and the smoky tang gave the whole dish a camp fire feeling like you were eating the best smokes you had ever had.  There was also a very nice wine list. Bravo. I will return next time I visit Albany.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear yecats59, 

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. We appreciate your feedback and would like to thank you for your kind words in regards to our staff, food, and décor. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your dining experience with us at Wellington's and look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Albany!

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Food
data.text: The restaurant has very good food. The atmosphere is a little bit cold. No special menu for kids. Prices ok.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear barbarbX6010MD,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. We would like to apologize that our atmosphere felt a little bit cold, but we are happy to hear that you enjoyed your food. We hope you choose to dine with us again at Wellington's in the future so we may provide you with a warm and welcoming atmosphere.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely Dining Experience, with a glitch or two
data.text:
My boyfriend and I ate here recently after being intrigued by the seductively chic interior on a few walk-bys. We had an overall very positive experience and found past reviews to be accurate:  excellent staff, very good food, and slow-side service. 

We never mind waiting for good food and actually view extra time as a nod to quality.  The Sous Chef, Chance Borawski is off-the-charts with his creativity. Witness the roasted Brussels Sprouts tossed with cubes of Peccorino and hazelnuts bathed in a honey-chlii glaze, and the delicate mounds of cubed pork belly and pico de gallo atop a flaky tostada. A basket of golden-brown Saratoga Chips with a side of horseradish aioli rounded out an enjoyable round of appetizers. 

Our server, Rayisha, was marvelously warm and friendly and enhanced our time there. Our entrees were absolutely delicious. The downside, however, was the food temperature: lukewarm. If the food had been hot, the succulent scallops and pork chop with Chanterelle cream would have been pitch perfect - each were perfectly prepared. The restaurant manager was very gracious and understanding when we pointed this out. All this coupled with the restaurant's heady-hip-well-heeled vibe spells out definite return visits.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear DiamondGirl1011,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. Thank you for mentioning both Chance and Rayisha and we are happy to hear that they were able to create a memorable experience for you. I would like to sincerely apologize for the slow service and the temperature of your food. We look forward to seeing you again soon so that we may better your experience with us!

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Surprisingly wonderful restaurant!
data.text: We stayed in the Renaissance and were too tired to forage for food so we decided to try the on site restaurant.  We usually find that hotel restaurants over charge and under deliver but Wellingtons was a pleasant surprise!  I had the salmon--one of the best dishes I've had in a while--tons of flavor and cooked perfectly.  My husband had the beef barley soup and the endive salad.  He loved both.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Carrie D,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. We are happy to hear that we were able to surprise and delight you in Wellington's and that you enjoyed your dinner with us. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Good Supper
data.text: We met friends for dinner at the Wellington Restaurant in the Renaissance Hotel.  It is a highly designed modern space inside a historic hotel.  We were a party of six and we were seated at two round tables pushed together.  It was awkward, but we had a great view of the Capitol.  The chairs were narrow with high arm rests and they were not comfortable to eat in.  We shared hushpuppies to start.  Caesar salad was standard.  We had the salmon, lobster gnocchi, chicken, and hamburger entrees.  All were very good.  Portions were on the smaller side.  Our server was nice, but seemed a bit inexperienced.  Plates were cleared before everyone had finished.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Bourlingeur60,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. With aspiration to always exceed guest expectations, we have unfortunately fallen short of this goal during your recent visit to Wellington's. Your valued feedback highlighted a number of areas for improvement that I have since shared with the Executive Chef and Restaurant Manager, who join me in offering their apologies for their team’s shortcomings. We hope to have an opportunity to the future to better your dining experience with us.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food, awkward seating, slow service
data.text: Nice place to eat in historic hotel across the street from the capitol building.  Good quality food but slow service, at least the Sunday morning that we were there.  More of a lounge than sit down restaurant.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear stevendale,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. Upon reading your review, it appears that we have fallen short of your - and our - expectations and for that we would like to sincerely apologize for the slow service that you received at Wellington's. We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us in the future. 

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Downtown Brunch
data.text: We were here for brunch without reservations on a Sunday morning.  We were seated timely in the very attractive dining room.  We were given a quiet corner table, which worked well with a 2 year old child.  The servers were very nice but the service was quite slow.  I ordered the Hudson Valley apply pancakes which ended up to be a stack of 5 or 6 pancakes with a small scoop of chopped sautéed apples on top.  It was okay, but disappointing.  I was expecting something more like crepes or fancier somehow.  My daughter had the French toast, which is made with croissants; she said it was good.  Son in Law had the corned beef hash and eggs, and said it was good.  It appears the kitchen is far from the dining room, so none of the food arrives super hot.  I would certainly go here again, as this is a fairly new place and maybe they just need to work out some kinks.  The dining room and bar are very very attractive, with a nice sophisticated ambiance.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear bbeeAlbanyNy,

Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback in regards to your recent dining experience at Wellington's. I would like to apologize that your experience did not meet your expectations. Please feel free to reach out to me directly at 518-992-2500 if you would like to further discuss this issue for it would be my pleasure to assist you. We hope to have the opportunity in the future to better your experience at Wellington's.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Kitchen was SLOW, but staff delightful
data.text: Late breakfast 10am on a Sunday... coffee was excellent. Ordered an omelette and pancakes: omelette was hot and good, side of potatoes was tepid so maybe substitute with fruit. Three large pancakes were soakers, so maybe a short stack would suffice. Serving staff were very friendly and profusely apologized for the slow kitchen. They gave us mimosas to ease our pain.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. I would like to apologize for the breakfast service you experienced during your recent visit to Wellington's. We hope to see you again in the future and have the opportunity to better your experience with us.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Food with Great Service
data.text: We were staying at the Renaissance which made the Wellington very convenient. We had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here.  We are an older couple and often split meals.  The servers never blinked an eye when we ask them to do this.  They also did not charge a fee.  The food was good, especially the steak we had for dinner.  The breakfast was especially good.  I had the Eggs Benedict and my husband had an omelet.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear GlendaKHouston_Texas,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed each dining experience you had with us and we hope to see you again soon.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Gourmet breakfast
data.text: This place is pretty good. The coffee drinks are really good, and the breakfast items are interesting and delicious. I got the NY eggs Benedict, a variation on the traditional. It came out on a pumpernickel bagel, eggs, salmon, sauce, and was great! My dining companion got an orange cream French toast item that she enjoyed. We ordered corned beef hash which was chopped rather than the usual ground, and we liked the variation on that as well. The service was initially lacking - she was forgetting things, being absent too long, asking us what we wanted again, etc., but another waiter came over to make things run smoother and was very good. He sang for some people the last time they were there a few days earlier! We liked the food and will go back.

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin

data.title: The breakfast was fabulous...but
data.text: Great ingredients and everything was prepared very well except for the Benedict. The English muffin was soggy and there wasn't enough Hollandaise but the egg was poached perfectly. It was nice that you can order a single Benedict, though.

data.text: Breakfast foods with a twist, e.g. orange mousse french toast. Tasty but a bit pricey. Bar has a good variety of wine and beer.

data.title: Excellent Restaurant!
data.text:
Many restaurants do no match the hotel and can be iffy.  Not Wellingtgon's.  Located in the recently remodeled Renaissance Albany Hotel, my wife and I decided to try the restaurant due fatigue after we flew a red-eye from Washington State and didn't want to venture out after spending a nice day in Albany.  We love ordering shareable plates and so we ordered their mussels of the day, mac 'n cheese with pork belly, and charred Brussel sprouts.  Wow!  Each dish was perfectly prepared.  Being from WA State, we know something about mussels, like local Penn Cove mussels, but these Prince Edward Island mussels were just so tasty especially the way they were prepared.  The tomato broth that the mussels came in was perfect for dipping with the wonderful butter toasted bread that came with the dish.  We had to ask for more so we could sop-up the broth and didn't leave a drop left.  The mac 'n cheese was just wonderful with great cheesy taste, but not dry.  The pork belly added a great flavor and was well presented in a small square stainless serving dish.  Again, the bread was used to wipe the dish clean.  The Brussel sprouts were perfectly prepared with the sprouts done with a slight crunch and well charred to add to the flavor of the dish.  

Though full after these wonderful dishes, we decided to share an order of the apple grunt.  The dessert was prepared to perfection.  The apples and spice cake blended well and the ice cream and chocolate was a great topping.  Slightly tart balanced by these other elements helped to put an exclamation point to a great meal.  

Service was excellent and our servers were attentive and friendly.  The restaurant is modern and comfortable.  We enjoyed our booth seats that looked out on State Street, and is around the corner from the New York State Capitol.  What a great backdrop.

Should we ever make it back to Albany, we would definitely eat at Wellington's.  We recommended Wellington's to our friends in Saratoga Springs, they will be making a point of visiting the next time they are in Albany.

owner_response.author: Leola E, General Manager at Wellington's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Atombrew,

Thank you for taking the time to review our restaurant. We appreciate your feedback and your kind words in regards to your recent visit with us. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Thank you again for your time and we hope to see you again in the future!

Sincerely,

Leola Edelin
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious food at good prices!
data.text: The charred brussel sprouts are a must have! And I don't like brussel sprouts ! We had burgers, a salmon salad and some wine and were very satisfied and loved the ambience and decor!

data.title: Great service and good food
data.text: We dined one evening. I ordered the NY Strip Steak and wanted to try a NY origin Cabernet franc / Merlot to go with it but was wary because US wine lists sometimes omit critical information as the one at Joe's Oyster Bar did. So, I asked the waiter about the wine and he said he'd ask the barman (not a promising start) - but then he returned with two small sample glasses of the wine for us to try before deciding if we wanted a bottle with our meal. The wine was well made and well-suited to our meals so we ordered a bottle. It was very good, and unexpected service indeed.

data.title: Beautiful decor, great food
data.text: Stayed at the hotel on a Friday night and went here for dinner. The décor was modern and beautiful. Service was good and the food was excellent. It was very quiet but we didn't mind that. Enjoyed the tuna and decadent mac and cheese.

data.text: We ate here because it is in our hotel, but I would search this place out even if you're staying across town.  Decor is stylish, drinks are imaginative, and the food is outstanding.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: We chose this restaurant because we were staying at the hotel. We were not sorry! What an amazing place! From the decor to the food to our amazing waitress Celine. What a wonderful experience. The food quality was spectacular, the presentation beautiful. Absolutely nothing bad to say about our experience. We don't live in Albany or anywhere near. But if we did we would be back for sure!

Celines is certainly a wonderful asset to our team and always assist in making each guest's experience memorable. We hope to see you again in the future should your travels bring you back to Albany. 

Sincerely,

data.title: Pricey restaurant with limited menu.
data.text: The food is good, and the restaurant is very nicely decorated, but I am a vegetarian, and the menu is very limited.
